definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: I'll forget about work and focus on having fun with you. Ummmm….
sentences.chinese: 我会把工作忘掉，并把焦点放在与你共度上。

sentences.english: Others want to unlearn behaviors that only add to their problems.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人想忘掉只会增加他们问题的行为。

sentences.english: It keeps forgetting our names and getting lost on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 他已忘掉我们的名字也认不得回家的路。

sentences.english: Hey, you didn't forget about the D-man, did you?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，你没忘掉那个竹本君吧？

sentences.english: You can put that idea into mothballs and forget it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以摈弃那种想法并把它忘掉。

sentences.english: I put the pot on the gas-oven, and got away.
sentences.chinese: 我把壶放在煤气灶上，然后就走开把这件事忘掉了。

sentences.english: I've always been very good at repressing unpleasant things.
sentences.chinese: 我通常很擅长忘掉不愉快的事。

sentences.english: The past made us what we are now, and we forget it at our peril.
sentences.chinese: 过去造就了我们现在的样子，我们忘掉它是危险的。

sentences.english: And chances are, you ended up forgetting all about it.
sentences.chinese: 而很可能的，你最终通通都忘掉了。

sentences.english: But I have never forgotten it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我从来没有忘掉它。

sentences.english: The three trees nearly forgot their dreams.
sentences.chinese: 三棵树几乎忘掉了他们曾经的梦想。

sentences.english: I don’t think anybody really gets over his first love.
sentences.chinese: 我认为没有人能够真正忘掉初恋。

sentences.english: I put the pot on the gas cooker, after then I went away with forgetting it.
sentences.chinese: 我把壶放在煤气灶上，然后就走开把这件事忘掉了。

sentences.english: The trimmings are soon forgotten in a hand-to-hand encounter for life or death.
sentences.chinese: 在徒手生死格斗中，细枝末节很快就会被忘掉。

sentences.english: The best way to forget all your troubles is to wear tight shoes.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉你所有的烦恼的最好的法子是穿个小一号的鞋子。

definition: to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
